list_definition.definition: a building on a sports ground in which players change their clothes, store equipment etc

list_ex_of_english: The park has a nature center, playgrounds pavilions, scenic loop road, stables, a campsite, and eight trails open to hiking, mountain biking, and horseback riding.
Each of the wooden pavilions will house five children aged between three and 16 years old, and an adult looking after them.
All the other pavilions had stickers and souvenirs and people rushed to get them.
As part of this work the pavilions were restored, the boulevard renovated, and the beach resanded.
If we could only have in these housing schemes football grounds, pavilions and baths for the children it would make all the difference in the world.
Although its size is concordant with the house it adjoins, the pavilion's scale is not.
The pavilions allow impressive double-height rooms with mezzanines on their top storey.
Much the same could be said of the exotic plants in the parks' inevitable conservatories as well as the statues, grottoes, fountains and pavilions.
